title: Drawing, "Hebe Pours Wine into Jupiter's Bowl", ca. 1810
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Jupiter shown sitting on throne. He raises bowl into which Hebe pours wine. Mercury looks on. Below are two putti and an eagle, while above two putti fly with bowl of fruits.  Rays of unusual graphite marks are above at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Hebe Pours Wine into Jupiter's Bowl", ca. 1810.
ca. 1810. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3275.
